title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 11
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n people organization managers will be divided into 4 commissions  that follows these criterias: (i) each member is in exactly 2 commissions, and (ii) each 2 commissions has exactly one joint member. What is n?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 14
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the biggest positive integer that can divide all the numbers\n"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ 1 }^{ 5 }\\quad -\\quad 1,\\quad { 2 }^{ 5 }\\quad -\\quad 2,\\quad ...,\\quad { n }^{ 5 }\\quad -\\quad n"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 16
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the remainder of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ 43 }^{ { 43 }^{ 43 } }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" divided by 100 ?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 17
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4 pairs of husbands and wifes buy tickets for 8 seats in the same row in a show. 2 people will sit next to each other only if the two are pairs of husband and wife or have the same gender. How many ways are there to put these 4 pairs of husbands and wifes onto those 8 seats?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 18
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many 4-digit numbers in the form "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline { abcd } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\\le b\\le c\\le d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 19
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let's draw a regular polygon R with 2002 vertex along all of its diagonals. How many triangles that are formed that are of the vertex of R, but no side is the side of R?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 20
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A marathon competition is followed by four High Schools : Merak, Merpati, Pipit, and Walet. Each High School sends 5 runners. The runners who placed 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th will earn the points of consecutively: 7, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1. The points of each High School is the total of their 5 runners. The High School with the highest points is the winner. At the end, it was Pipit High School that was the winner and there are no two runners that finish at the same time. How many possibilities are there for the winning High School?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 4
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The real number 2.525252... is a rational number, so that it could be written in the form of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\frac { m }{ n } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where m and n are integers, n â‰  0. If it is chosen the numbers m and n that are relatively prime, what is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m\\quad +\\quad n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 5
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose M and m consecutively states the biggest number and the smallest number between all 4-digit numbers that has the total digit value of 9. What is the biggest prime factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M\\quad -\\quad m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

title: 2002 Math OSP, Number 6
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Review equation that has a form of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ x }^{ 2 }\\quad +\\quad bx\\quad +\\quad c\\quad =\\quad 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". How many equations thus that the equation has real roots if coefficient b and c can only be chosen from {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}?"}]}]}
